verses.kjv: Then wrought Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whom the LORD put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all manner of work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that the LORD had commanded.
verses.web: “Bezalel and Oholiab shall work with every wise-hearted man, in whom LORD has put wisdom and understanding to know how to do all the work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that LORD has commanded.”
verses.ct: Bezalel, Oholiab, and every skilled craftsman in whom the LORD had placed wisdom and understanding to know how to do the work — they all carried out the construction of the sanctuary, exactly as the LORD had commanded.

verses.kjv: And Moses called Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whose heart the LORD had put wisdom, even every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it:
verses.web: Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whose heart LORD had put wisdom, even everyone whose heart stirred him up to come to the work to do it.
verses.ct: Moses summoned Bezalel, Oholiab, and every skilled person whose heart the LORD had filled with wisdom — everyone whose heart moved them to come and do the work.

verses.kjv: And they received of Moses all the offering, which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, to make it withal. And they brought yet unto him free offerings every morning.
verses.web: They received from Moses all the offering which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, with which to make it. They kept bringing free will offerings to him every morning.
verses.ct: They collected from Moses all the offerings the Israelites had brought for building the sanctuary. But the people kept bringing additional freewill offerings every morning.

verses.kjv: And all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they made;
verses.web: All the wise men, who performed all the work of the sanctuary, each came from his work which he did.
verses.ct: Eventually, all the skilled workers who were doing the various tasks on the sanctuary stopped what they were doing and came to Moses.

verses.kjv: And they spake unto Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work, which the LORD commanded to make.
verses.web: They spoke to Moses, saying, “The people have brought much more than enough for the service of the work which LORD commanded to make.”
verses.ct: They told him, "The people are bringing far more than we need to complete the work the LORD commanded."

verses.kjv: And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.
verses.web: Moses gave a commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, “Let neither man nor woman make anything else for the offering for the sanctuary.” So the people were restrained from bringing.
verses.ct: So Moses gave an order, and an announcement was sent throughout the camp: "No one — man or woman — should prepare anything more as an offering for the sanctuary." That put a stop to the people's giving.

verses.kjv: For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
verses.web: For the stuff they had was sufficient to do all the work, and too much.
verses.ct: What they already had was more than enough to finish all the work.

verses.kjv: And every wise hearted man among them that wrought the work of the tabernacle made ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubims of cunning work made he them.
verses.web: All the wise-hearted men among those who did the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen, blue, purple, and scarlet. They made them with cherubim, the work of a skillful workman.
verses.ct: The most skilled craftsmen among the workers made the tabernacle itself. They crafted 10 curtains from finely woven linen in blue, purple, and scarlet, with cherubim expertly woven into the fabric.

verses.kjv: The length of one curtain was twenty and eight cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: the curtains were all of one size.
verses.web: The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits. All the curtains had one measure.
verses.ct: Each curtain measured 28 cubits long and 4 cubits wide. All 10 curtains were exactly the same size.

verses.kjv: And he coupled the five curtains one unto another: and the other five curtains he coupled one unto another.
verses.web: He coupled five curtains to one another, and the other five curtains he coupled to one another.
verses.ct: He joined 5 of the curtains together as one set, and the other 5 curtains together as a second set.

verses.kjv: And he made loops of blue on the edge of one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling: likewise he made in the uttermost side of another curtain, in the coupling of the second.
verses.web: He made loops of blue on the edge of the one curtain from the edge in the coupling. Likewise he made in the edge of the curtain that was outermost in the second coupling.
verses.ct: He attached loops of blue fabric along the outer edge of the last curtain in the first set, and did the same along the outer edge of the last curtain in the second set.

verses.kjv: Fifty loops made he in one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the edge of the curtain which was in the coupling of the second: the loops held one curtain to another.
verses.web: He made fifty loops in the one curtain, and he made fifty loops in the edge of the curtain that was in the second coupling. The loops were opposite to one another.
verses.ct: He made 50 loops on one curtain and 50 loops on the matching curtain of the second set, with the loops lined up directly across from each other.

verses.kjv: And he made fifty taches of gold, and coupled the curtains one unto another with the taches: so it became one tabernacle.
verses.web: He made fifty clasps of gold, and coupled the curtains to one another with the clasps: so the tabernacle was a unit.
verses.ct: Then he made 50 gold clasps and used them to fasten the two sets of curtains together, making the tabernacle one unified structure.

verses.kjv: And he made curtains of goats’ hair for the tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains he made them.
verses.web: He made curtains of goats’ hair for a covering over the tabernacle. He made them eleven curtains.
verses.ct: He also made a covering of goat hair to go over the tabernacle, using 11 curtains in all.

verses.kjv: The length of one curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits was the breadth of one curtain: the eleven curtains were of one size.
verses.web: The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits the width of each curtain. The eleven curtains had one measure.
verses.ct: Each of these curtains measured 30 cubits long and 4 cubits wide. All 11 were the same size.

verses.kjv: And he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
verses.web: He coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
verses.ct: He joined 5 of these curtains into one set and the remaining 6 into another set.

verses.kjv: And he made fifty loops upon the uttermost edge of the curtain in the coupling, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain which coupleth the second.
verses.web: He made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was outermost in the coupling, and he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain which was outermost in the second coupling.
verses.ct: He made 50 loops along the outer edge of the last curtain in the first set, and 50 loops along the outer edge of the last curtain in the second set.

verses.kjv: And he made fifty taches of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
verses.web: He made fifty clasps of bronze to couple the tent together, that it might be a unit.
verses.ct: He made 50 bronze clasps to fasten the two sets together into one unified tent covering.

verses.kjv: And he made a covering for the tent of rams’ skins dyed red, and a covering of badgers’ skins above that.
verses.web: He made a covering for the tent of rams’ skins dyed red, and a covering of sea cow hides above.
verses.ct: Over that, he made a covering of ram skins dyed red, and over that another covering of badger skins.

verses.kjv: And he made boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood, standing up.
verses.web: He made the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing up.
verses.ct: He constructed upright frames for the tabernacle out of acacia wood.

verses.kjv: The length of a board was ten cubits, and the breadth of a board one cubit and a half.
verses.web: Ten cubits was the length of a board, and a cubit and a half the width of each board.
verses.ct: Each frame was 10 cubits tall and 1 and a half cubits wide.

verses.kjv: One board had two tenons, equally distant one from another: thus did he make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
verses.web: Each board had two tenons, joined to one another. He made all the boards of the tabernacle this way.
verses.ct: Each frame had 2 tenons spaced evenly apart for joining. He made every frame for the tabernacle this way.

verses.kjv: And he made boards for the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side southward:
verses.web: He made the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side southward.
verses.ct: He made 20 frames for the south side of the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And forty sockets of silver he made under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.
verses.web: He made forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards: two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
verses.ct: Under these 20 frames, he placed 40 silver sockets — 2 sockets under each frame, one for each tenon.

verses.kjv: And for the other side of the tabernacle, which is toward the north corner, he made twenty boards,
verses.web: For the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty boards
verses.ct: For the north side of the tabernacle, he also made 20 frames,

verses.kjv: And their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
verses.web: and their forty sockets of silver: two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
verses.ct: along with their 40 silver sockets — 2 sockets under each frame.

verses.kjv: And for the sides of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
verses.web: For the far part of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
verses.ct: For the west end of the tabernacle, he made 6 frames.

verses.kjv: And two boards made he for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.
verses.web: He made two boards for the corners of the tabernacle in the far part.
verses.ct: He also made 2 additional frames for the back corners of the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And they were coupled beneath, and coupled together at the head thereof, to one ring: thus he did to both of them in both the corners.
verses.web: They were double beneath, and in the same way they were all the way to its top to one ring. He did this to both of them in the two corners.
verses.ct: These corner frames were joined together at the bottom and connected all the way up to a single ring at the top. He did this for both corners.

verses.kjv: And there were eight boards; and their sockets were sixteen sockets of silver, under every board two sockets.
verses.web: There were eight boards and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets—under every board two sockets.
verses.ct: So the west end had 8 frames in all, set in 16 silver sockets — 2 sockets under each frame.

verses.kjv: And he made bars of shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
verses.web: He made bars of acacia wood: five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
verses.ct: He made crossbars of acacia wood — 5 for the frames on one side of the tabernacle,

verses.kjv: And five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the sides westward.
verses.web: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the hinder part westward.
verses.ct: 5 for the frames on the other side, and 5 for the frames at the west end.

verses.kjv: And he made the middle bar to shoot through the boards from the one end to the other.
verses.web: He made the middle bar to pass through in the middle of the boards from the one end to the other.
verses.ct: He designed the middle crossbar to run through the center of the frames from one end to the other.

verses.kjv: And he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold to be places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
verses.web: He overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold as places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
verses.ct: He overlaid the frames with gold, made gold rings to hold the crossbars, and overlaid the crossbars with gold as well.

verses.kjv: And he made a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubims made he it of cunning work.
verses.web: He made the veil of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, with cherubim. He made it the work of a skillful workman.
verses.ct: He made the inner curtain — the veil — from blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and finely woven linen, with cherubim skillfully worked into the design.

verses.kjv: And he made thereunto four pillars of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold: their hooks were of gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.
verses.web: He made four pillars of acacia for it, and overlaid them with gold. Their hooks were of gold. He cast four sockets of silver for them.
verses.ct: He made 4 posts of acacia wood for it and overlaid them with gold. Their hooks were gold, and he cast 4 silver sockets for them.

verses.kjv: And he made an hanging for the tabernacle door of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, of needlework;
verses.web: He made a screen for the door of the tent, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer;
verses.ct: For the entrance to the tent, he made a screen of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and finely woven linen, decorated with embroidery.

verses.kjv: And the five pillars of it with their hooks: and he overlaid their chapiters and their fillets with gold: but their five sockets were of brass.
verses.web: and the five pillars of it with their hooks. He overlaid their capitals and their fillets with gold, and their five sockets were of bronze.
verses.ct: He made 5 posts with hooks for this screen and overlaid their tops and bands with gold. Their 5 sockets were made of bronze.
